qas.question: Who used the term anthropology to describe the natural history of man?
When was anthropology used as a term for comparative anatomy?
When was a chair created for anthropology at the National Museum of Natural History?
Where is the National Museum of Natural History located?
What organization was formed by members whose primary objective was the abolishment of slavery?

plausible_answers.text: the natural history, or paleontology, of man

qas.question: What did Etienne Serres describe in the 18th century?
Where was a chair in anthropology and ethnography created in 1838?

plausible_answers.text: Jean Louis Armand de Quatrefages de Bréau

qas.question: Who created a chair in anthropology and ethnography in the 18th century?
What group first used the term Ethnology in the 18th century?
What society abolised slavery in France?

context: Sporadic use of the term for some of the subject matter occurred subsequently, such as the use by <a0_0>Étienne Serres<a0_0/> in <a1_0>1838<a1_0/> to describe <b5_0>the natural history, or paleontology, of man<b5_0/>, based on comparative anatomy, and the creation of a chair in anthropology and ethnography in <a2_0>1850<a2_0/> at the <b6_0>National Museum of Natural History<b6_0/> (<a3_0>France<a3_0/>) by <b7_0>Jean Louis Armand de Quatrefages de Bréau<b7_0/>. Various short-lived organizations of anthropologists had already been formed. <b8_0><b9_0>The <a4_0>Société Ethnologique de Paris<b9_0/><b8_0/><a4_0/>, the first to use Ethnology, was formed in 1839. Its members were primarily anti-slavery activists. When slavery was abolished in France in 1848 the Société was abandoned.
